titlestmt.titleproper: Theodore MacManus letter to W.H. Solle
Guide to the Theodore MacManus letter to W.H. Solle, 1935 May 2 RL.11309
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-01-24 11:52:14 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Theodore MacManus letter to W.H. Solle

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Advertising executive, author and philanthropist in Detroit, Michigan; principal in the D'Arcy MacManus Masius agency. Letter to William H. Solle, a bookshop owner in Omena, Mich. answers an inquiry regarding forthcoming poetry. MacManus reminisces on the ironies of his life, reflections, his legacy as author of the Cadillac "Penalty of Leadership" advertisement of 1915. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born 1873, New York. Founded MacManus Agency, Detroit, 1927; merge to form MacManus John & Adams 1934; MacManus died 1940, Ontario. 1970 merger created D'Arcy MacManus; 1972 merger D'Arcy MacManus Masius; 1985 D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles; 1996 MacManus Group.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Theodore MacManus letter to W.H. Solle was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Theodore MacManus letter to W.H. Solle, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

MacManus reminisces on the ironies of his life, reflections, his legacy as author of the Cadillac "Penalty of Leadership" advertisement of 1915. Acquired as part of the John W.
